Description: Rim and body sherd of South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim; interior: reserved band at top of rim, glazed black below; exterior: black band at top of rim, reserved below; band at top of reserved handle zone.
Type series: Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type B2 (possibly)
Curator's comments: Although Schlotzhauer (Schlotzhauer 2012) does not discuss thissherd, the profiel and decoration find parallels with Schlotzhauer’s (Schlotzhauer 2012) South Ionian cups with everted rim Type 9B. Type 9B cups closely follow the shape and decoration of the Attic Plain Komast cups. These cups coincide with Hayes’ Ionian Cup Type IX (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-116) and Villard’s Ionian Cup Type B2 (Vallet and Villard, 1964, 87-88). Type 9 cups have been found in large numbers in other sanctuary settings including at the Sanctuary of Demeter and Kore at Tocra, and at the site of Megara Hyblaea on Sicily. This type was the most common type of South Ionian cups with everted rims found at Naukratis. The Type 9 shape evolved from the earlier Type 5 cup shape.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.660) (Phase 3)
